threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects creation of cron file or files in Cron directories which could indicates potential persistence.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), MSTIC

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET DROP Spamhaus DROP Listed Traffic Inbound group 24

attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, for GNU/Linux 2.6.9, stripped

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The sample is a malicious backdoor that establishes persistence by creating both an init script (`/etc/init.d/%s`) and a cron job (`/etc/cron.hourly/gcc.sh`). The cron job is configured to run every 3 minutes by modifying `/etc/crontab`. The malware performs extensive system reconnaissance by reading from `/proc` to gather CPU, memory, and network information. It exfiltrates this data and receives commands via HTTP GET/POST requests. It also contains anti-forensic features, such as setting `MYSQL_HISTFILE=/dev/null` to prevent MySQL command history logging, and ensures network connectivity by executing `ifconfig $i up` on all network interfaces.
